text:
My name is Scout! My professional website was built using the R package distill: you can find it here!
I wanted to try website-building using Quarto documents, though, and so I am trying this out as a place to share my personal passion: knitting!
If you, too, knit and want to connect, follow me on Ravelry!

title: Projects
text:
Kingston Sweater



My mom sporting her Kingston sweater!



Pattern: Kingston Sweater
Designer:: Tara-Lynn Morrison
Yarn Used: Knit Picks Tuff Puff
Colorways: Pomegranate and Snickerdoodle
Recipient: My mom!

I knit this sweater in spring of 2021. Itâ€™s the 3rd sweater I knit after one grueling sweater that took one (1!) whole year.
After that first tough one, I realized the fast and furious giagantic yarn patterns would be better for my learning. It is super gratifying to fly through the rows and helpful for my understanding to just knit through the whole sweater in a short amount of time. With the Kingston, I felt pretty confident about top-down raglan-style garment construction.
The Knit Picks Tuff Puff Yarn wasnâ€™t bad for the low, low price of $6 per 100% wool skein. The yarn splits a bit, but the color choices are fantastic, and my mom would be horrified by the price points of other yarns. Bargain yarn is more our style :)



We love a raglan shoulder MOMENT!




Cable Seed Hat



Papa wearing his cable seed hat in downtown Truckee.
